column4: Early Civilizations: The eight features of civilizations include cities, well-organized central governments, complex religions, job specialization, social classes, arts and architecture, public works and writing. Early peoples developed unique civilizations. Several civilizations established empires with legacies influencing later peoples.
First Global Age: The transoceanic linking of all the major regions of the world led to economic, political, cultural and religious transformations.
